about_the_game:
NOTICE: DUE TO FINANCIAL ISSUES, THE GAME HAS BEEN PUT ON INDEFINITE HOLD.



A 15-year-old boy genius named Cole Andrews finds himself in the Virtual World, unsure of how it happened. Upon further reflection, comes to the conclusion that a machine he created brought him in by mistake. Later, panic ensues after realizing that he didn’t finish the architecture or functions that allow a manual exit to be created.

As he begins to meltdown, a sound emits from afar. This sound communicates with Cole, giving him hints on what to do. The sound gives Cole the feeling of “motive”, imploring him to go higher. Confused, he then received some vital information: He’s high in the sky, and that there IS, in fact, an exit at higher altitudes.

Now knowing there’s a chance to escape, he begins his journey to reach the exit. However, the further he goes, the more he realizes just how big his problems really are, and how his “Perspective” really changes things...

Remember,

“Everything is not what it seems…”

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04, Ubuntu 18.04, or CentOS 7
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 8th Gen 2.00+ GHz
  • Memory: 4 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Any GPU w/Shader Model 4.0 capabilities
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Any default sound card
  • Additional Notes: Best with screen ratio of 16:9 or equivalent
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS
  • Processor: Intel Core i7 10th Gen 2.00+ GHz
  • Memory: 8 MB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Realtek Audio

short_description: In this game, you play as 15-year-old Cole Andrews on a journey through a Virtual World his machine generated. Using Perspective, you'll have to help Cole get through every Altitude in the world, and reach the exit. Remember, "Everything is not what it seems..."
